description: From French liberticide, coined around the time of the French Revolution. Equivalent to liberty +‎ -cide.

entries.meaning: Causing the destruction of liberty; oppressive, liberticidal
examples: […]  by aſſembling at her houſe, in ſecret council, the principal chiefs of that conſpiracy, and by keeping up a correſpondence tending to facilitate their liberticide deſigns.
All that has been done by the state since the revolt of May is liberticide of the most violent character.

entries.meaning: One who causes the destruction of liberty.
